protein.specific_function: Factor IX is a vitamin K-dependent plasma protein that participates in the intrinsic pathway of blood coagulation by converting factor X to its active form in the presence of Ca(2+) ions, phospholipids, and factor VIIIa

go_class.description: peptidase activity, acting on l-amino acid peptides
